title: Jellyfin-media-renamer (JMR)
description: A command line tool that mass renames files to comply with the Jellyfin naming scheme.
projectText: This was the first big(ish) project that I made. Originally it was bloated and way bigger but I was able to refactor it to make it smaller by using the Java.File object. This tool takes files which usually contain a lot of gibberish to follow the jellyfin naming scheme for movies, shows and season folders.

title: Portfolio website
description: This very website ! A portfolio website created using React and hosted by github pages.
projectText: I originally created this project to train and study for the final exam of my web programming course at the University of Eastern Finland. While making the first version I learned a lot of how React works. One year later I decided to update it before sending it with my CV to possible employers. During the past year I had become a lot more familiar with React. I had started using Typescript which I found to be a lot more logical to me as a person who is most familiar with Java and C++ than regular Javascript. I had also used it in other courses and the biggest change was that I had used it to create a e-commerce website for a start up company I am/was a founding member. The updated version is miles a part from the old version which can still be found as a different branch.
usedTechnologies: React, Vite, Typescript, Bootstrap, Github Pages

title: Github data analyzer
description: A CLI tool that fetches data from GitHub projects and returns useful data for analyzing projects
projectText: I started this project after I wrote a study paper for a course at the University of Eastern Finland. My paper was about the structure and SDLC of open source projects. For the study paper I reviewed around 30 different open source projects which were mostly hosted in Github. I quickly noticed how tedious the work was to collect the data of contributors, maintainers, commits and release cycles. After finishing that course I started writing this project so in my free time I could do a better study paper with hundreds of projects instead of just tens of projects.

title: Apaja
description: An E-commerce website for buying fishing licenses in Finland
projectText: I was/am a founding member in this project. The project was not technically anything special but it did allow me to improve my React skills. I also learned alot about the business side of programming projects and devops. My duties in this project was being the lead frontend developer but I also was involved in the design of the backend. I also lead the team of five students who made the first prototype of the backend and frontend. I also did some contributing to the python backend but 80% of the work I did was on the frontend.
usedTechnologies: React, Vite, Typescript, Python, AWS, Python, SQL

title: Java2UML
description: A CLI tool for creating UMLetino compliant UML drawings of java projects
projectText: I started this project so I could get a better understanding of UML. I thought it would be neat to have auto generated UML graphs instead of manually making them.

title: BulletTime
description: A CLI personal planner and calendar
projectText: This was the first project I started working at when I started my studies at the University of Oulu. The moodle workspace where most of the studies are organized was insufficent and it made me miss some deadlines.

title: Linux ricing
description: A compilation of config files and scripts to copy my setup and desktop environment quickly from Github
projectText: I have been using Linux ever since highschool when I learned that I could side load Linux to my school laptop with a locked down version of Windows 10. I side loaded Linux so I could play video games during boring classes. Later while I was reinstalling Windows on my home desktop I tought that while I am reinstalling windows why not try Linux. After the first five minutes I had been sold. After that I have used Linux. This project contains install scripts for ubuntu and arhc based distros. It also has my sway window manager config.
